feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 10:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues due to warmer temperatures. * WHERE...The northern Copper River Basin along the Gulkana River and along Lake Louise Road.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Okaloosa and northeastern Santa Rosa Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 145 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Baker, or 14 miles northeast of Milton, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail.
